title: David Pastrnak’s 400th career goal with Bruins was fitting — for several reasons
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: David Pastrnak scored his 400th career goal for the Bruins during a 5-3 win against the Toronto Maple Leafs.
Pastrnak now ranks sixth in franchise history with 401 goals, one shy of Rick Middleton's 402 for fifth place.
The Bruins' win is their seventh consecutive victory, part of a turnaround after a previous six-game losing streak.

title: Northern Lights illuminate Boston-area skies
author: Sana Muneer
bullets: Northern Lights were visible across Boston and Massachusetts on Tuesday night due to a geomagnetic storm.
The aurora displayed colors from blue to green to pink and was visible nationwide, including in Boston suburbs.
There's another chance to view the Northern Lights Wednesday night, according to meteorologist Eric Fisher.

title: As Patriots’ young core grows, Stefon Diggs calls Mike Vrabel a ‘perfect parent’ to guide them
author: Khari A. Thompson
bullets: The Patriots are 8-2, equaling their combined win total from 2023 and 2024.
Stefon Diggs praises coach Mike Vrabel for his supportive, player-friendly approach.
New England's young core includes players like Drake Maye and Christian Gonzalez.

title: MIT scores legal win as federal court dismisses appeal in lawsuit claiming campus protests were antisemitic
author: Molly Farrar
bullets: A federal appeals court dismissed a lawsuit claiming MIT failed to curb antisemitism during pro-Palestinian protests on campus.
Jewish students alleged that pro-Palestinian actions included rallies, gatherings, and altered Israeli flags, but these were not deemed antisemitic.
The court ruled that MIT's actions were adequate and that restricting protest speech further would infringe on free expression.

title: Pastrnak scores twice, hits 400-goal milestone as Bruins beat Maple Leafs
author: The Associated Press
bullets: David Pastrnak scored twice, reaching 400 career goals, as the Bruins defeated the Maple Leafs 5-3.
Pavel Zacha, Hampus Lindholm, and Alex Steeves also scored for the Bruins, while Jeremy Swayman made 30 saves.
Auston Matthews left the game with a lower-body injury, and Toronto goaltender Anthony Stolarz exited with an upper-body injury.

title: Jeff Passan maps out ‘perfect’ offseason move for the Red Sox
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Craig Breslow identifies a top pitcher as a priority for Red Sox's offseason strategy.
Jeff Passan suggests trading for Minnesota's Joe Ryan to bolster Red Sox rotation with Garrett Crochet.
Joe Ryan posted a 3.42 ERA and 194 strikeouts, under team control till 2027, aligning with Red Sox needs.

title: Patriots players got a surprise blue-collared gift from Mike Vrabel
author: Khari A. Thompson
bullets: Mike Vrabel gifted New England Patriots players blue collared shirts inspired by his time with the Browns.
The shirts are a team bonding gesture as Vrabel likes giving gifts to boost morale and unity.
The Patriots are on a seven-game win streak heading into their divisional match against the Jets.

title: ‘Ride and Walk for Your Life’ pedals toward safer streets, will push for reform
author: Sana Muneer
bullets: 'Ride and Walk for Your Life Boston' includes a memorial bike ride, walk, and a rally advocating for safer streets.
The event is part of the World Day of Remembrance for Road Traffic Victims, aiming to prevent road crash fatalities.
Advocates seek support for bills on traffic law violations and increasing truck safety in Massachusetts Legislature.

title: Tips for getting stubborn bird droppings off of an SUV
author: John Paul
bullets: Use warm water with dish detergent on a microfiber cloth for 15 minutes to soften bird droppings on cars.
A mixture of baking soda and water or a handheld steamer can help remove stubborn bird droppings from vehicles.
Consult a professional car detailer if home remedies fail to effectively remove bird droppings from your SUV's surface.

title: Patriots have a new secret weapon on offense in 335-pound defensive tackle
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Defensive tackle Khyiris Tonga is being used as a fullback by the Patriots, enhancing their offensive and defensive plays.
Tonga has played a key role in New England’s 28-23 win over the Buccaneers, contributing as a defensive and offensive player.
Patriots Head Coach Mike Vrabel values Tonga’s versatility, utilizing him on defense, offense, and special teams for strategic advantage.
